cutoffvalue 2.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • cutoffvalue: An R Package for Cutoff Value Determination & Graphing

    Generate a histogram, with associated parameters, from the dataset

    fitparams.Rd

    This function produces a histogram of the data that will be used for fitting curves. As a matter of course, this function runs the cleanData and datamodel functions for you, negating the need to run those separately.

    fitparams(rawdata, breaks = 15)

    Arguments

    rawdata

    Your data file; data should be organized in an Excel document as a single column of log- or natural log-transformed data without a column header.

    Value

    Returns a basic histogram for the data set along with various parameters used to generate curves for the final plot.

    Examples

    fit <- fitparams(rawdata)
#> number of iterations= 134
